TopicTitle: The birth of the Evil Space Consortium

Articles.Content:
Good "whatever time it is where you are" everybody!

Having enjoyed the game for a few months now, i think it is time i decided to join the Kerbal community.

36 year old from Québec (yeah, french guy, so forgive me if my English is sometime not up to par), having always enjoyed a difficult game where you had to think more than you need to smash buttons on a  controler, i'm very happy to have found this game!

So, well.... hello all and looking foward to share my experiences with fellow minded Kerbals!

Once i had free time, now i have Kerbal!

Hello Madscientist16180 and welcome to the forum!

I'm a 52 year-old Albertan and I, also, once had free time.

You have found an excellent venue for sharing your KSP experiences and for seeing what others have shared.

Happy landings!
There's a lot of Canadians in here - why don't we have a better space program?

Lol, probably cause "we" do not have the money for it!

Tks for the welcome, i'm looking foward to posting some screenshots from my program when work is done in à few hours.

My vessels are working well enough, but i'm looking foward d getting advices on making them less money expensive. I feel i'm throwing too much kerbal$ on each launch.

 

It's been ages since i last posted a picture on any forum, hope it's still the same process it was like 10 years ago lol.

56 minutes ago, Madscientist16180 said:

It's been ages since i last posted a picture on any forum, hope it's still the same process it was like 10 years ago lol.

Upload your images to an image hosting service.  Imgur.com is a popular and well-supported one on this forum.

Then, while creating a post, you can click the 'Insert other media' button at the bottom right.  When the box pops up asking for the URL, paste in the link supplied by the image hosting website.

Happy landings!
Sounds familiar enough, tks for the advices.
